The absence of an obvious alien threat has made us look rather irrelevant for the past twenty years, Commander - but we had little doubt we would be needed some day. It seems that day has come. (The free novella Xenonauts: Crimson Dagger tells the story of the Iceland Incident and is included with the game under the "Extras" button of the game launcher)

Further study of the alien Singularity Core has allowed us to weaponise it without consuming the Core itself - important not simply because the Cores are in short supply, but because they contain so much energy that releasing it all at once would annihilate literally everything in the combat area. The Singularity Cannon is so heavy that it can only be wielded with assistance from a Predator battlesuit, but it is capable of unleashing almost unimaginable destructive power.
The device is built around a Singularity Core and functions by siphoning off a tiny fraction of the energy held within, then imparting it into a specially-designed slug of alien materials. This slug consists largely of looped superconducting alloys, the only substances able to contain the enormous quantity of energy involved. The slug is then projected at high speed towards the target using our existing MAG technology, deforming on impact and thus breaking the superconductor loop. This causes a vast release of energy and similarly enormous damage to anything that happens to be in the area. The effect is not quite as extreme as the blast from one of our Singularity Torpedoes, but the results are still astonishing.
The Singularity Cannon requires reloading with a new slug after each time it is fired, but the Core itself should be good for approximately a million shots. Constructing one would be a major undertaking, but the sheer power of the weapon would surely be worth it - I seriously doubt the aliens have anything that could survive a hit from this weapon; I can assure you that our species does not.

The alien Assault Plasma is a two-handed alien infantry weapon roughly twenty-eight inches in length and five kilograms in weight. Though it employs a different method of operation, it acts much like a shotgun in effect: it spits multiple "pellets" of deadly plasma at the target.
These "pellets" are, of course, nothing of the sort. Each is an individual bolt of plasma fired from one of the weapon's three entirely separate barrels. The device employs a particularly large generation array, which allows all three of the barrels to simultaneously discharge a bolt of plasma that is almost as powerful as the bolt fired by the alien Plasma Rifle. This makes the weapon highly dangerous at short range: if all three shots strike the same target, it is unlikely to survive the experience.
Thankfully, this weapon is inaccurate, has mediocre armour penetration and a very limited range - it does not appear to utilise the standard graviton emitter seen on other alien weapons at all. Tackle enemies wielding this weapon at distance, as it relies on proxmity rather than precision.

The Defence Battery is a point-defence structure that provides your base with protection against UFOs. In the event that your base is attacked by enemy forces, your defence batteries will each take a shot at the attacking craft with a 50% hit chance before the ground assault begins.
Several defence batteries may be able to destroy an attacking UFO before it lands, averting the attack completely - but inflicting any damage on the UFO at all will reduce the size of the alien ground forces appropriately (to a minimum of 50%). These batteries upgrade automatically as you research more advanced weapon technology, so will not become obsolete over time.

As the name implies, the Garage houses any Xenonaut vehicles stationed at the base. Each garage will hold up to three vehicles and a free Garage slot is required before construction can even begin on a ground vehicle.

Each Hangar will house a single interceptor or dropshop; a free hangar bay is necessary before you are able to purchase or construct an additional aircraft.
These structures are quick to construct and have relatively low upkeep, but the aircraft they house do not. Decommission any unnecessary aircraft quickly!

Laboratories allow a base to conduct research. Each Laboratory will house up to 15 scientists, who require both living space and laboratory space to be available before they can be recruited. Research is networked across different bases, so multiple scientists working on the same project from different bases are just as effective as if they were housed in the same facility.
Research performed in a laboratory suffers diminishing returns: the first scientist on a project works at 100% efficiency, the second at 99% efficiency, the third at 98% efficiency (and so forth). Finally, as laboratories are expensive and have unusually high maintenance costs, consider your finances carefully before constructing one.

Living Quarters provide housing for up to 35 personnel - either Soldiers, Scientists or Engineers (any combination of the three personnel types can be housed in the same structure). Living space and any appropriate work space must be in place before new staff can be hired, so ensure your bases have enough living quarters to accommodate your expansion plans.

The Medical Center structure provides Xenonauts with state-of-the-art medical care for any injuries they sustain in battle, halving the recovery times of any injuries inflicted on your soldiers.
Building additional Medical Centers beyond the first has no extra effect on healing speed.

Radar Array structures allow a base to detect extraterrestrial UFOs. The detection radius of the base is shown as a blue circle on the Geoscape; any UFOs that enter this circle will be detected almost immediately irrespective of distance from the facility.
The radar range of a base can be expanded by constructing additional Radar Arrays, however this will only apply three times (i.e. there is no point building a fourth Radar Array).

The Storeroom of a base houses all manufactured or recovered equipment at the base. This is not required for items that are available in unlimited quantities - so aircraft weapons / ammunition or ballistic weapons for your soldiers will still be available without a Storeroom. However, the base cannot receive any manufactured soldier weapons or armour until it has storage space for them, nor collect any Alenium / alien alloys.
A single Storeroom is capable of holding an unlimited quantity of items.

Workshops allow a base to construct aircraft, vehicles and battlefield equipment. Each Workshop will house up to 15 engineers, who require both living space and workshop space to be available before they can be recruited. Unlike Laboratories, Workshops are NOT networked - engineers in different bases cannot collaborate on projects.
Engineers suffers diminishing returns when at work: the first engineer on a project works at 100% efficiency, the second at 99% efficiency, the third at 98% efficiency (and so forth). Finally, as workshops are expensive and have unusually high maintenance costs, consider your finances carefully before constructing one.

The "jump unit" is the informal name we have given to the collection of propulsion and flight-control systems that work together to allow small alien units vertical movements. The fundamentals are not particularly complex; the British-built Harrier jump-jet demonstrated them more than a decade ago. Scaling them down to the point where they can be integrated into personal armour, on the other hand, is.
We finally meet the future, We can make a replica of Alien Alloys

The X-44 Saracen is an interceptor built for dogfighting manuverable alien crafts. It is fast, armoured and agile, employing dual cannons to rip apart its foes at close range.
Within it lies the mountings for Sidewinder-class missiles and a cannon of our choice, the extensive avionics and the imposing E-77 Alenium Impulsion reactor that provides the vast reserves of power required to make a sixty-ton craft dance like a ballerina at twice the speed of sound.
The resulting craft is an ugly, squat beast capable of destroying almost anything placed in front of it - so no doubt our engineers will feel a certain kindred spirit when they begin to build one.

Despite only being the size of a household fridge, the power unit recovered from the UFO still produces enough energy to power a city the size of New York. Surprisingly, however, the device proved utterly inert once switched off - not even appearing to radiate heat.
The construction of the device is equally peculiar. It consists of a cylindrical outer casing of alien ceramics, the interior of which is dotted with hundreds of tiny laser emitters. Sitting inside this is a rotating inner casing that is packed with a lattice of unidentified yellow crystal, again cylindrical in shape. The origin and composition of these crystals has yet to be determined, but there is no question that they form the heart of the reactor. For want of a better name, my team have dubbed the material "Alenium" and are in the process of removing the lattice from the casing to allow further study. Preliminary scans suggest that there is an almost incomprehensible amount of energy stored within these Alenium crystals, despite the lattice being no larger than a football. This material is potentially one of the greatest discoveries of recent times; we should begin research on it immediately.
The rest of the power source contains little of interest. All of the materials used in its construction have been encountered in larger quantities elsewhere in the hulls of recovered UFOs and the machinery itself is not overly complex; studying it has yielded nothing worth commenting upon. The only mystery surrounds the sea of identical laser emitters covering the interior of the outer coating - we are as yet unaware of their purpose. Studying a couple of examples have provided only minor advances in our understanding of laser technology, mostly in the areas of beam focusing and miniaturisation of optical amplifiers. I very much doubt that the aliens are unable to produce far more powerful laser emitters, suggesting that they have deliberately been designed to only emit low intensity beams. We would be interested to know the significance of this with regards to the Alenium lattice; it may give us an avenue of research when we begin to study it.
Finally, I understand you have received a request (from personnel in a department which will remain nameless) seeking to prevent me from dismantling such devices inside the base in future. I must object to the repeated usage of the phrase "reckless disregard" and I can assure you I am no more keen to end my life in an enormous fireball than anyone else in this base. I therefore request you tell the staff concerned to stick to what they know (i.e. building things, making unintelligible grunting noises)...

The Alien Grenade is a small explosive used in a similar way to conventional human grenades. The ceramic shell contains a small plasma generation array activated by pressing a button on the top of device. Unlike the generation array alien infantry weapons, the Alien Grenade makes no attempt to focus or shape the resulting projectile - instead it exhausts its entire Alenium power supply in a single moment and dumps all of the plasma into the surrounding area in the form of a sizeable explosion.
There is thus no fragmentation element to the damage inflicted by the Alien Grenade - it is purely an energy weapon. This gives the device a relatively limited blast radius and a rapid drop-off in power from the epicenter of the blast to the edge, but also means that it will be deadly to any units caught near the middle of the blast until we develop more advanced infantry body armour. It is highly recommended that commanders avoid bunching their troops together in a manner that may attract an Alien Grenade.
Additionally, our scientists have adapted the design of the Alien Grenade to create the Alenium Grenade. This device contains a core of Alenium crystals studded with miniaturised lasers, surrounded by a conventional fragmentation shell fabricated from Alien Alloys. Once triggered, the Alenium crystals detonate and propel the razor-sharp shrapnel through the blast area at far higher speeds than a normal grenade can muster.
Preliminary tests suggest that the Alenium Grenade has a similar blast radius to the conventional Fragmentation Grenade, but inflicts up to 50% more damage to anything caught within. These grenades are now available for production in the Workshop.

Hello Commander, as you requested, we at Strategic Planning have started analysing the alien activity from a military point of view. Meaning no disrespect to R&D, but interpreting ET strategy is best suited to the men who do it for a living. I'll be keeping you updated on whatever we can discover about extraterrestrial UFO activity.;Earlier today there was a confirmed sighting of a UFO, light scout class, circling low over a research station in America. It didnt take any visible action but local radio operators detected unusual bursts of energy in the VHF band, and the researchers detected simultaneous bursts in the SHF band. I've cross-linked this with similar reports in Germany, Australia and Hong Kong. Considering the strategic importance of the locations involved and the analysis of light scouts from R&D, I'm certain these scouts were gathering and transmitting intelligence on potential future targets ;UFOs on scouting missions remain in the air for an extended period of time, gathering intel on potential targets. There doesn't seem to be any particular plan to what they cover, so it should be fairly easy to intercept one. As the ETs have dedicated ships for scouting, you can expect scouting missions to be carried out by small signals. The more intel a scout can gather, the more damaging later attacks will be so try and get as many scouts taken down as you can. Even if we cant recover the crash site, we can at least make sure the ETs are fighting in the dark.

Before I left the air force and came here, my last job was working the crank file and if I didn't know better, I'd say some joker had shipped everything from Langley and left it on my desk. That stack of reports in front of you is a sizeable chunk of recent UFO sightings, and they're like something out of a comic book. Theyre mostly scenes of unusual, almost paranormal activity such as storms suddenly appearing out of nowhere, eerie glowing lights, and signs of unexplained cattle mutilation. I even have a report from a man who claims to have been abducted then rejected by his abductors. The ETs seem to be carrying out some kind of research, but for what reason we dont know.;Research missions seem to be restricted to their scout ships who will scan a pre-defined area, looking for suitable subjects and locations to carry out their experiments. Scouts doing research will also land fairly frequently to obtain samples and carry out field work. Research missions can result in casualties, but nothing major. Whatever they're up to Commander, I think it's better we don't get a chance to find out. Don't you?

I was talking with the heads of Communication and Detection over the latest UFO movements and between us weve spotted a new and dangerous direction the ETs are heading in. A short while ago we cant be sure exactly when - a UFO slipped through the net and targeted, get this, a music festival! The organisers had held it in an open field, in the mistaken belief that UFOs only attacked towns. Reports suggest the ETs took less than a quarter of an hour to turn most of the festival goers into ash. The reason Im bringing this to you because this wasnt an airstrike the ETs used ground teams to carry out this massacre.;We dont have a lot to go on our sponsors got to the few witnesses who survived first, and while we have now have transcripts of the interviews, there are maddening gaps in the information. What we can be certain of was there were a significant number of ETs involved in this attack, and they had deployed some sort of man-sized Frankenstein which got fried by an unshielded power cable. ;My team thinks this was a test run and we can expect further attacks by cadres of alien shock troops, tasked with terrorising funding nations by slaughtering the civilian population. One of my juniors whos a history buff drew a parallel between this and a method used by Genghis Khan. Hed obliterate a city and threaten other cities with the very real threat of vanishing as well if they resisted. ;Successful terror attacks are the most damaging of any alien mission to our organisation. Our sponsors have strongly hinted that nuclear protocols will be deployed to prevent what they call biological contamination. The politicians will blame us to keep Joe Citizen off their backs and our funding and reputation takes a hit thats hard to come back from. If we do save a city from the ETs that will look particularly good for us and we can expect a big boost in funding for every terror site we clean up. UFOs on a terror missions are medium-grade signals at a minimum, and they are almost always escorted. They will try to throw us off the scent, so look for slow moving signals which move randomly but seem to be circling a specific patch of cities - they are likely on a terror mission.

I was talking to one of the junior researchers at R&D (the seniors dont have time for us grunts), and she told me they had identified over three and a half thousand separate alien craft orbiting our world. If they all landed tomorrow wed be dead. As it is, the ETs have "merely" committed to the largest air war since Hitler was in power. ;Pattern analysis of ET airstrikes suggests theyre currently focussing on soft targets - highways, small towns, even isolated warships on patrol. These targets are difficult for emergency services to respond to and the ETs ability to strike and retreat anywhere makes it hard for local forces concentrated nearer the larger population centers to intercept. ;Ground attack missions can be carried out by any grade of signal, from the smallest to the largest. Rather than being given a specific target, UFOs will patrol a patch of the planet looking for targets of opportunity. UFOs tasked with a ground attack mission will strike several times before retreating to rearm and refuel and can cause serious havoc. ;Theyre damned clever, Commander. They strike at locations that make no immediate military or economic impact, but they whittle away at our confidence and cut lines of commerce and communication. If we become isolated, the planet will shut down as effectively as if they bombed every capital into rubble. Our experience and detection tech gives us a fighting chance against ET strikes, but the fact is there are too many of them and too few of us to handle them all at once. My advice is to get as many bases built as you can. Never mind R&Ds bleating for more funds. Those nerds have no idea of how the real world works and we need boots on the ground, not heads in the sky.

R&D was able to extract and translate a flight plan from the wreckage of the ET bomber we shot down and has passed it over to us. Weve mapped the route and it intersects the industrial zones of several cities as well as a classified submarine dock. The timing is too tight and the sites too large for ground landings but adequate for a string of rapid, heavy airstrikes. Commander, it looks like the ETs are going to step up their air campaign. ;We can expect ET bombers to target strategic, economic and civilian targets of significance, but with a whole planet to pick from its going to be difficult to predict where theyre going to strike. Thankfully, if this flight plan is any indication, it looks like theyll be tasked with several targets in each run which exposes them to attack by our interceptors. Bombers are very likely to be escorted, and will be a medium-class signal or larger. Look for medium signals with an erratic flight pattern but no recorded landings those are the most likely targets. ;Predicted casualties from a strike are expected to be the hundreds, so shut them down as a priority Commander. We can always send in a team to deal with ground landings, but bombing runs can only be intercepted.

What do you want to hear first, the good or the bad news? The good news is were having a serious impact on ET air operations. Theyre now using fighter craft to escort their larger ships, which means our interceptions have hurt them. The bad news is that theyre taking the fight to us, starting with our own aircraft. ; The ETs have set up combat air patrols to directly counter our own interceptors. UFOs tasked on interception missions will patrol the skies until we launch our own aircraft. They will then (most likely informed by orbital spotters) head directly towards our own craft and intercept our squadrons. Its fairly easy to make out a squadron tasked with an interception mission. They are always interceptors of some sort, so look for signals which indicate only very small UFOs. Be aware of the danger to your dropships, Commander! I would recommend clearing out any squadrons with interception missions first before tackling other craft, to prevent any accidents happening to the ground team.

I have a report of an engagement between local forces and ETs around a historically important mountainside, with tourist numbers in the thousands. Look at the photos here, and here. You can see theyve used some kind of device to bore several tunnels into the rock. Unfortunately, this isnt just simple-minded vandalism. This is something more sinister. ;The ETs orbital fleet gives them the freedom to strike at any target in any part of the globe. This freedom is restricted by their lines of supply. ET UFOs need to head back to their motherships to refuel, which the eggheads tell me is physically taxing even for their advanced technology. Their fleet itself must need a massive and ongoing supply operation to provide it with everything it needs. ;The logical step is to construct forward operating bases on the planet as places for refitting and repairing smaller craft, staging areas for ground-based missions and supply dumps for foraging expeditions to reduce supply dependency. These tunnels look like test bores to see if that mountainside would be a suitable candidate. Pity they didnt do their homework, eh? ;National landscapes beside, we can expect ET bases to be set up in remote locations away from centres of population. This will make it hard to track them down. Ive dispatched agents to gather what information they can and our analysts are pouring over historical UFO sighting data but this will take time and it isnt a reliable source of information. The most reliable way to detect an ET base is by tracing UFO activity. ;Only medium-class signals or higher will carry out base construction missions. Look for medium signals that land, take off again and land shortly after, doing this several times. Thats a sign the ETs are surveying sites to see if they are suitable for a base. ;Their bases will need essential supplies they cant manufacture themselves, and their landing craft are well suited as haulers. So also look for medium-class signals which dawdle over locations that doesnt seem to be either a city or your own bases. If you follow those craft to their end destination, they should lead you to the location of the ET base. ;ET bases are parasites that will sap the will of the funding nation they are attached to. While they dont have an obvious short-term effect, over the long term they are as dangerous as any direct alien attack.

Reports have been trickling in from an old friend in the armed forces that the ETs are executing ground attacks on military bases. The most notorious attack to date has been on a deep nuclear launch facility. A covert group of ETs were able to access the base despite most of it being half a mile underground. It was only by collapsing the residential wing that the base commander saved anything. That worries me, because if the ETs are doing it to the nationals, sooner or later theyll do it to us. ;The consequence of ETs successfully attacking one of our bases is the loss of all operational assets in the base and the particular area covered by the base will be undefended until we can construct a new one. Even if we drive them off ETs can cause lasting damage by wrecking hangars, destroying labs and demolishing workshops. Dont sit about and wait for the ETs, Commander. Go and meet them in force! ;Without a way of intercepting and decoding alien communications, itll be hard to tell if a UFO is going to mount an attack on our base or if theyre intending to attack a city. Look for escorted medium-class signals and above. They arent going to make it obvious that theyre going for us, but sooner or later they will have to head directly to our base. The bases most likely to be attacked will be the ones they have the most operational data on i.e. the oldest. It would probably be a good idea to station a garrison or erect defences at the bases most at risk.

That was a bad business with Hawkins, Commander. Im certain she was intending to breach the quarantine seals on the Caesan subject we have had under study. Thankfully she opened the Reaper larvae maturation pod instead. The silver lining on this cloud is that we have been able to closely study the effects of Reaper larvae metamorphosis. Pursuant to your request on more information about Reapers, I have drawn together what we know about their class structure and appended what data we have on Reaper zombies as well. ;Alpha Reaper: As if the standard Reaper werent bad enough, we have identified certain Reapers who are faster, stronger and more resilient than their common brethren. These alpha Reapers are relatively few in number but they are just as fecund as the standard Reaper. Left unchecked they can reduce cities to gibbering zombie hordes in short order. The Alpha Reaper is identifiable by its lighter hue. ;Zombie: The zombie resembles a hunchbacked waxwork thats been stood too close to the fire. Facial features run together and the limbs become elongated, muscle-bound and misshapen. The hunch, from which the rapidly maturing larvae will burst from is lined with blotchy veins. In this state zombies can do little more than swing their limbs while screaming in pain and rage. Dont let a zombie get too close! The hosts death triggers a hyperaccelerated burst of growth in the larvae, and you dont want the birth scream of a new Reaper to chime with the death rattle of your soldiers. ;Alpha Zombie: Alpha zombies are superficially the same shape, but the processes which create the alpha supercharge the zombie. Their shapes are more capable of bearing the extra load of an alpha, and as a consequence they are faster, stronger and more resilient. ;Be very careful if your own troops are infected, Commander. While they dont have the brains to use their weapons, they still wear the tattered remains of their armour and it will provide more protection than the torn clothing that graces civilian zombies.

Commander, please talk to your men. If a test subject manages to breach quarantine, the correct response is to subdue and restrain it until our specialists can get to the scene. It is most emphatically not to grab whatever is to hand and reinact the more bloody scenes from the Texas Chainsaw Massacre, even if the subject does manage to teleport into the canteen and scare the occupants. When your brutes had finished, there wasnt enough left of the Wraith for tissue analysis. ;Like Harridans, Wraiths have a truncated class structure. This is probably to do with their elite status in the alien hierarchy no Wraith need sully its hands with manual labour! While Wraith battle armour is a uniform green, we have noticed a considerable amount of personalisation with no suit exactly the same. This is probably how Wraiths distinguish themselves socially and indicates that Wraiths have a surprising level of independent thought in the alien hierarchy. We have identified certain strata of rank within the Wraith military, identifiable by the amount of armour it is permitted to wear. ;Soldier: The Wraith solider class wears a segmented, armoured bodysuit with additonal plating at the shoulders and typically carries a plasma rifle. While this would seem a little underpowered, their ability to teleport into flanking positions and behind vehicles makes the need to carry heavier weapons unnecessary. ;Warrior: The Warrior class has considerably more variation in armament, with heavy plasma and plasma cannons being quite common. Apart from addtional plates on the legs, the primary difference is in the thickness and quality of the subdermal armour implants which considerably improve their resilience. ;Officer: Like other officers, the Wraith officer class is the only class to wear a helmet which covers the most vunerable part of their anatomy - the blue nodes. We don't really understand why more Wraith don't wear helmets to protect their node. While the nodes do produce a lot of heat, cooling shouldnt be an issue for am empire who can apply superconductor to surfaces like paint. ;Elite: Examination of the Elites armour suggests considerable after market modifications, the most common being a treatment similar to the hardening process we have observed in Landing Craft. We have also noted implants of an unknown type that improve the flexibility, agility and overall resilience of the Elite. Elites wear the most complete suits of armour - a green bodysuit similar in design to Sebillian Elites, as well as a more enclosing set of armour plating. </Data></Cell>

Like some of the more obnoxious bean-counters in administration, the Harridan class structure is short, blunt and myopically focussed on its role. We have identified several classes of Harridans, their primary distinguishing feature being the quality, coverage and effectiveness of the armour they wear.;Solider: Often seen accompanying Androns (no doubt to provide technical as well as long-range support), the blue-and-white Solider class is the most common opponent you will face. I hope I shouldnt have to warn you about their skill with sniper rifles, or their jump-packs.;Warrior: The most obvious upgrade the purple Warrior receives is the addition of armoured gloves and boots as well as upgrades to their targeting systems. Warriors have been seen carrying plasma cannon as well as plasma rifles, so watch out!;Officer: Officers are easily identifiable by both their red armour and the additional set of wings on their backpack. The Harridan Officer acts less as a commander and more as a co-ordinating node between different Harridans. Officers are the most intelligent of the Harridan race and are the most independently minded, so be wary when facing one. ;Elite: The Elite is physically indistinguishable from other Harridans, however their black and grey suits are of the highest quality and incorporate powered elements that vastly improve their physical and mental capabilities. A near tactical match for Officers, the Elite is superior to other Harridans in every way.;Unusually, there is no evidence of higher-ranking leaders among the Harridans. Our best hypothesis is the nature of how Harridans behave precludes the mental capacity for grand strategy. They depend upon leaders from other races to provide them with direction and targets.

Commander, exactly what did you expect when you asked Engineering for details on Androns? Their rambling, jargon-filled essay wallowing in the trivia of Andron machinery is hardly the kind of briefing the men need or can understand. Look, the first thing you need to know is there are no non-combatant types among Androns. These walking death machines are capable of fine manipulation and their adaptive logic enables them to operate equipment without special assistance. Any Andron is as capable in combat as it is piloting a UFO. Secondly, we have gathered data on two broad classes of Andron seen in the field.;Guard. We have dubbed the camo-green Andon "guard"-class due to their fairly predictable behaviour patterns and their protective attitude towards other aliens. It is is the most commonly reported model on the field. Generally equipped with a plasma rifle, but also seen with heavier weapons, this class of Andron is a terror to common soldiers and should be approached with care by any trooper only armed with a rifle. ;Soldier. Larger, more imposing and better armoured than the guard-class, the navy blue solider class Andron exclusively carries heavy weapons, especially the heavy plasma gun. The shorter range of the plasma gun means it must get closer to be in optimal range, but that suits the Androns style of attack.

Commander, the surliness of Engineering is not my fault. They should develop thicker skins if theyre going to be in this business. In the interest of good relations, I have asked them to provide their expertise in analysing Androns, and they have provided a useful insight. As a general rule, the more dangerous an Andron is, the larger and bulkier it becomes, with the Elite class as the apex of power and physical size. ;Warrior: I hesitate to call any model of a mass-produced robot a veteran, but this description best fits. The light blue Warrior class is better armoured and equipped than the front-line solider class, and more importantly has superior logic and tactical analysis systems. ;Elite: The GT model of Androns with all the optional extras. The massive Elite class sports a fancy red paint job while retaining the same basic form of the Warrior. Under the carapace a fascinating combination of sophisticated recoil dampers, gravitronic stabilisers and a powerful load-bearing frame turns the Elite into a bipedal micro-tank, capable of moving and shooting heavy weapons without a significant drop in accuracy or speed. ;Officer: This majestic purple monster possesses the same power as the Elite, but packs it into a sleeker frame. Officers are the most dangerous Andron you will face and thats saying something, as they combine the raw power of Elites with a deep tactical intelligence.

Commander, our Xenosociologist has been compiling information on the Sebillian race. Most of it, while interesting, is irrelevant for field operations. I have taken the time to compose a summary of the most useful information for the men.;Im sure youve heard the self-congratulation and back-slapping going on in the locker room over the success of the last mission. I hate to turn those smiles into frowns (actually, I dont) but those hard targets were, amusingly enough, not intended for ground operations. From our data we have strong reason to believe these are non-combatants. They form the operational core of any UFO crew, acting as pilots, engineers, navigators and other essential noncombat roles. They neither need nor are given more than basic training in combat, are armed with pistols and only have their naked (if resilient) skin as protection. (Incidently, I have had to chastise some lab assistants for skinning Sebillians and selling their hides to your men. Did you know that corporal England is an amateur leatherworker? I should check their uniforms, if I were you.);Our Xenosociologists theorise they are either a slave caste, bred in their millions to serve the needs of the higher echelons or younglings who have yet to find their position within the larger social group and are assigned duties suitible for young aspirants who cannot yet be trusted with a gun. In either case, they will likely stick close to grounded UFOs and it is extremely unlikely that the men will see them in any dedicated alien combat operation.

Commander, kindly tell those knuckle-dragging graduates from Jarhead Academy to stop bothering my staff when they are off-duty. We deal in verifiable facts, not half-baked rumours and pie-in-the-sky hearsay. When we have reliable information, we will pass it on. Like now, for example. Here is our analysis of the combat-ready Sebillian types the men will face.;Guard. The next step up from the non-combatant, guard-class Sebillians are comparatively larger, equipped with plasma rifles and wear a breastplate made form alien alloys which provides some protection while giving them freedom of movement. Our observations of them suggest that they prefer defensive postures. Their true role may be shipboard security, rather than frontline soldier.;Soldier. Soldier-class Sebillians are the closest to what we would consider front-line troopers. They wear a more complete set of body armour, covering the brest and groin. They also wear additional armour on their comparatively vulnerable legs and have been seen to carry heavier (and nastier) weaponry. Film footage donated from some of our sponsors suggests their weapons can liquefy an un-armoured man in a few seconds.;If you cant drive anything else into the thick heads of your men, beat into their skulls this following equation. More armour = more dangerous.

Commander, Ive analysed the most recent after-action reports and Im both concerned and pleased at the same time. The Sebillian war machine has responded to our continued operational success and rapid technological advances by committing their most experienced troops to the field in an effort to stamp us out. This will prove an error on their part, as their leaders and officers are now closely supervising ground operations which gives us an opportunity to obtain vital intelligence from the higher echelons of the Sebillian army. My team has put together what information we have on these elite troops for your perusal. ;Warriors/Elites. Sebillian veterans distinguish themselves from their lowly brethren by the quality of their armour and the ornate shoulder plates they wear. They are tougher, faster and stronger than anything you have faced previously. Standard armament for Warriors is the heavy plasma gun and the deadly plasma cannon. Watch out for Sebillians wearing a red gambeson under their armour plating. This is issued to the Sebillian equivalent of human special forces, a real Elite that will test your men severely. ;Officers/Leaders. The officer class is the only class which wears any kind of headgear - this is probably for cultural reasons. Keep watch for the distinctive domed helmet of an officer. They are the most intelligent of their kind, although this doesnt say very much as social progression for a Sebillian seems to be based less on tactical brilliance and more on personal prowess in battle. Expect a tough fight from an officer, Commander.

From the earliest recording of a crashlanding in Puglia, Italy in 1910 to famous incidents such as the Gateshead Grey abductions, humanity has held an endless facination with "little green man from Mars". Now they are here, and with sinister intent. I've prepared a summary of what we know for your distribution, as our brave boys have slept through every briefing I have given them. Perhaps you could invite them to a story at bed-time.;It's unsurprising our soldiers tore through the Caesans like a shark in swimming pool. The examples we have brought in for study are ill-prepared for a fight. Caesans in red jumpsuits seem to fill non-combatant roles, such as technician or navigator. Given their unique genetic structure, they may be manufactured on a production line basis then programmed to meet specific manpower needs.;Like our own pilots and engineers, they are only lightly armed and perform poorly in groundside combat. Their jumpsuits are resistant to impacts, but while it can absorb a 9mm bullet it is considerably less effective against a hail of rifle rounds. I would expect to find non-combatants on every UFO you bring down, but never in any dedicated combat operation.

Commander, I dont appreciate the looting of valuable research materials from crash sites. I especially dont appreciate those same research materials appearing as trophies in the man cave your soldiers call a barracks. The colouration of different Caesan jumpsuits has a clear sociological meaning that we have yet to penetrate, and it doesnt help our cause when they are spirited away to be kept as knickknacks and good luck charms. Regardless of this setback, we have begun to distinguish between different colours and have the results below.;Guard. Blue-jumpsuited Caesans represent the first combat-ready Caesan we have met. Armed with plasma rifles, they can hold their own against a squad of ordinary soldiers. Their jumpsuits have several reinforced layers that can take considerably more punishment, although their physiology remains the same as non-combatants. ;Soldier. The Guard, while fearsome, isnt what we would consider a front-line trooper. That distinction is given to the Soldier-class. Considerably more aggressive than the Guard-class, the Soldier carries a wider variety of armaments and isnt afraid to fling grenades at any tightly-packed group of soldiers that get in its way. Its jumpsuit is marked by dark blue arms and light blue shoulderpads.

Spoon-Benders. Aura-Readers. Fortune-tellers. Psychics. Even with the miracles of alien technlogy laid out in my lab I would have never, ever credited that psychic phenomina existed except in the heads of the credlous and the cretinous. But in the face of evidence that I can reliably repeat, what else am I to call it? Psychics are real, Commander. ;It's clear now why the Caesan brain is supersaturated with Alenium nanoparticles. These particles react with their unique brain structure in a manner we don't yet understand to power abilities that you or I would recognise as psychic. But while it seems that all Caesans have the potential for psychic powers, only a select few actually express this ability. Given what we know about Caesans, psychic abilities are probably deliberately left out of the standard clone, reserved for an elite few. We have termed these Caesans Psions, and they are recogniseable by the lurid purple jumpsuits they wear. ;Thankfully, psychic gifts seem entirely related to various modes of telepathy. Thourough testing of a Psion shows that it could manipulate gross emotions (especially the sense of fear) and implant hallcinatory images (it was at that point I had to personally terminate the beast). You need not fear that a Psion will telekinetically lift a car and throw it at one of the men! However, I suggest advising squad leaders to make any Caesan in a puple jumpsuit a priority target. Their powers are subtle, and are all the more dangerous for being so.

Specifications: Fire Mode: Burst Fire 23AP Accuracy: 28% Fire Rate: 4 Bullets (16 Bullets per turn with full auto fire) Damage: Pistol Ammo Caliber .45 (20 Nominal damage, 10 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: None Range of effect: Medium
Tactical Briefing: - Suited for urban and close quarters combat. - Can be used with shields. - Highly effective against low armored units. - Quick reload system. - High ammo consumption.
The Sub Machinegun EF-Z701 Enforcer is our first step towards building an arsenal effective enough to repel the alien invasion. The Enforcer is humanities first weapon designed specifically according to the newly obtained data and not just the old second-hand research we had from the Icelandic incident.
Although, I will be earnest, Commander. We are still in a stage where producing effective weapons based on alien technology is far beyond our means. The Enforcer is more of an adaptation of our regular firearm than an invention of its own. But it is an adaption driven by the knowledge of what makes our enemies blead. Or at least the presumed knowledge.
The logic behind our reasoning was that the aliens are equipped with weapons which were originally desinged to kill their own kind... and that does seem to be the case in our simulations using alien corpses (sadly enough human flesh seems to be equally affected). Therefore in order to penetrate their defenses we must imitate the characteristics, if not the technology, of their weaponry.
The mainframe of The Enforcer is a Heckler & Koch M5. We have, however, adjusted the barrel and equipped the magazines with explosive .45 rounds. This produces a hail of bullets which explode on impact. Effectively copying the effect of a single, low energy, plasma beam.
Commander, I do not even want to concern my mind with what should be the work of petty clerks, but it does seem a good idea to start producing The Enforcer on a mass scale and selling it back to our funding partners. An anti-alien weapon certified by my team should make a nice profit. It is pitiful enough that we have to work on a limited budget, let us try to squeeze out extra funds by whatever means possible.

Executive Summary: Preliminary UFO Analysis
While the alien craft downed during the Iceland Incident was destroyed before it could be recovered, the research team has spent considerable time collecting and examining reports from eye-witnesses along with arial photographs of the crashsite before the explosion. Amongst other things, this analysis suggests that the alien craft may possess one or more weak-points in their outer hulls which our operatives might exploit during tactical missions using specially designed explosive charges. By breaching the hull of the alien craft, our operatives will be afforded superior access to the vessel and therefore be better placed to overpower any extraterrestrial defenders.
The breaching charge we have designed for this purpose is simple to use. The charge uses electromagnetic clamps to descure itself to the hull of the alien craft. Once deployed, an operative need only set the detonator and retreat a few paces to ensure they are not caught in the blowback. The device is highly precise and the collateral damage it causes is minimal. This should avoid the unnecessary destruction of alien artefacts and allow operatives to deploy close to the intended breach site.
[To use the breaching charge, place it in an operative's hands and arm it as with C4. The Breaching Charge should then be dropped next to the intended target of the charge, and the operative retreated at least two squares away from the location it is deployed.]

Specifications: Snap Shot 24AP - 44% accuracy Aimed Shot 60AP - 98% Accuracy Burst Fire 32AP - 32% Accuracy Fire Rate: 4 Bullets in burst fire Damage: Special Rifle Ammo Caliber .45 (33 Nominal damage, 18 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Low Range of effect: Versatile
Tactical Briefing: - Most advanced ballistic rifle developed in XNT Facilities. - A versatile and powerful weapon for all ranges. - Only heavy armored units can stop this special ammo without damage. - Slow to reload - High ammo consumption and high recoil.
Commander, have you considered expanding our laboratory complex? It is getting quite cramped with all the alien artifacts being shipped. Additional working space would always be welcome.
Of course, I do not requests such generosity whilst approaching you empty-handed. I would like to present to you the latest fruit of our hard labor. The LMG MK-ZP802 Zephyr.
Unlike The Enforcer, Zephyr is not a modified version of any commonly available firearm but a completely new design made in collaboration with all of the world's most esteemed arms manufactures. We have received books-worth of blueprints and patents and as you might have noticed experts from NATO and the Warsaw Pact were recently invited to our laboratories to help with the project. At times it's difficult to remember that the Cold War is truly over.
You do imagine the embarrassment I had to endure? Trying to organize everything in our cramped compartments and our dwarfed underground laboratories. Hardly anything that could be called a decent working environment. I am certain that additional funds allotted to the research division would significantly benefit the number of guests we can harbor and innovations we can produce.
Amidst the harsh working conditions we did, however, produce a light machine gun which is as reliable as a Kalashnikov, as accurate as a FN FAL and its penetration capabilities are much more than you would expect from a weapon of this size.
The drawback is the recoil produced. Now I have read the combat reports, and it seems that you soldiers, although being drawn from the worlds elite, are behaving subpar in face of the terror of an alien invasion. This might be a biological reaction which I think will be overcome through xeno-combat experience. But until your soldiers get some of that experience and regain their potential strengths and capabilities, I do advise you to issue Zephyr only to your more experienced soldiers. The trembling hands of a rookie will be better suited to something from our more traditional arsenal.

Specifications: Fire Mode: Burst Fire 30AP Accuracy: 30% Fire Rate: 7 Bullets per burst (21 Bullets per turn with full automatic fire) Damage: Pistol Ammo Caliber .48 (29 Nominal damage, 10 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Low Range of effect: Medium
Tactical Briefing: - Suited for heavy suppression and cover destruction. - The extreme firepower can overcome grouped enemies. - High recoil and weight limits the use of the weapon to restricted situation and trained soldiers. - Very slow reload.
Have you ever wished having one of those Vulcan auto-cannons attached to one of our Charlies and have them support your ground operations? Admittedly, it is a tempting idea but, Im afraid, that would make our helos even more of a priority target. As if the invaders weren't keen enough on shooting them down already. Moreover, helos are an extremely easy target and would not be able to extended plasma fire. I'm sure the pilots would instead prefer to maintain a low profile and leave things as they are.
Instead I propose we start manufacturing the HMG Korhang KR-R331 Heavy Machinegun. In many ways, this is but a simple, scaled down Vulcan and its main role is to cut down our enemies with as much bullets as able and as fast as possible.
Many manufactures actually tried to design an infantry weapon of the sorts, a long time before the invasion even started. But to scale down something as monstrous as a 112 kg Vulcan and to keep it viable in battle was just impossible with the technology and materials they had to work with. That is not the case anymore. Our studies on cooling systems obtained from extraterrestrial drones have proven to be a great asset.
Korhang is a great tool of destruction, suited for removing obstacles and harassing enemies. Suppression, comes to mind when thinking of Korhang and that is surely what you will get, as long as your soldiers are strong enough to use it. Please remember that the bullets were not designed to penetrate heavy armor. As with most of our newly designed weapons Korhang still weights much more than would be desired and the recoil is dreadful. You will always want to have another soldier covering the Korhang user as the weapon has, perhaps, the most complicated reloading system of our entire arsenal. Korhang has its place in between our standard heavy machinegun and our rocket launchers although it does not directly replace them. One more thing, Commander. Its obvious to us at this point that we will soon be employing more and more energy weapons in our arsenal. Please do remember that some of our enemies poses a natural (or should I say: a genetically modified) resistance to energy damage. Therefore a weapon such as Korhang might be still useful to us in the long run... and if not I am sure that it does look intimidating enough to give us a good price at the international arms market.

Specifications: Snap Shot 18AP - 30% accuracy Normal 28AP - 50% Accuracy Aimed 48AP - 105% Accuracy (laser sights) Fire Rate: Single shot Damage: Pistol Ammo Caliber .50 (35 Nominal damage, 20 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Low Range of effect: Low (dual) / Medium (laser sights)
Tactical Briefing: - Powerful impact can damage armors without need of anti-armor ammunition. - Laser Sight mounted provides high accuracy even with long distance shots. - Can be used as a dual weapon OR with shields. - The weight, recoil and reload time makes this weapon suited only for veteran soldiers.
Einstein once said that he did not know what weapons would be used in World War III but he was certain that the war after that would be fought with sticks and stones. I am more inclined to say that there will be no further wars if we lose the one we are fighting now. At least non concerning humans.
Fortunately, having more knowledge than Einstein (and lets not be modest: more intellect), I am at the position to say what weapons ARE used in War World III, as we might call our current encounter with the alien invaders.
Namely, you will want to use the Warhawk WR-H33. It is a heavy pistol designed to bypass light and medium armor. It is a powerful weapon in close quarters combat and can also be used at medium range. That is, if you pose a designated marksman with enough aiming skills; or if you attach the handy laser sights (No, the laser sights are not the breakthrough in laser weaponry, which I was discussing with you earlier).
As you would imagine, a handgun like this will produce significant recoil. I advise to distribute it only amongst your strongest xenonauts. As it goes for the dual version, I have added a special mechanism that somewhat reduces recoil, at the cost of removing laser sights. Of course, using two Warhawks at a time is still more difficult than handling just one, but hopefully, not as much more difficult as you could expect.

Specifications: Snap Shot 30AP - 52% accuracy Aimed Shot 49AP - 104% Accuracy Fire Rate: Low Damage: Armor Piercing Shotgun Slugs (36 Nominal damage, 36 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Medium Range of effect: Medium range
Tactical Briefing: - Modified version of the conventional shotgun. - Versatile and powerful weapon suited for close and medium ranges. - Deals a great amount of kinetic damage which can both kill or stun a target. - Slow reload rate and limited ammo. - Limited rate of fire.
Commander, are you keen on the idea of recycling? You know, the concept of those pre-war activists. Oh, I know this is no time to be discussing environmental issues, but recycling did give me a rather extraordinary idea.
The SPECIAL OPS - ThunderBolt AZT300 is produced from the plating of enemy crafts. The only material that can withstand the ammunition used in this hybrid-tech shotgun. Mind you, I am not speaking about alien alloys, but the much weaker plating layers which we now store in plentiful supplies. As for the ammunition we use the by-products of alenium (mostly the same as in our alenium explosives). The micro-particles extracted from alenium serve as makeshift gunpowder. Once the trigger is pulled chemical reactions inside the shotgun emit a controlled explosion and the lead bullets are shattered and set into motion at a disturbingly high velocity. In result we are producing not only a hail of lead and alenium shrapnel but we also emit a shockwave that can knock an enemy down.
The shrapnel travels at a velocity high enough to easily penetrate medium armor, but the damage is, of course, limited due to the nature of shrapnel munitions being heavily inaccurate.
The most obvious drawback is the clip size. We did consider making the magazine larger, but then again, alenium powered bullets are not safe enough to be cramped together. Apart from that using alenium as gunpowder requires a reasonable amount of cooldown, even with the new coolants we have recently procured from the invaders.
Nevertheless, I do see the ThunderBolt as a very dangerous weapon and I do hope you will encourage your men to use it. If the assets of this shotgun do not appease you, then please have in mind us scientists. Commander, we need live specimen. And we believe the ThunderBolt can provide those. Even if they are missing a limb or two.

Fire Mode: - Snap Shot 13AP - 28% Accuracy - Normal 23AP - 55% Accuracy - Aimed 48AP - 120% Accuracy - Burst Fire 30AP - 32% Accuracy - Fire Rate: Fast - Damage: Focus Laser (43 Nominal damage, 35 Stun Damage) - Armor Penetration: Low - Range of effect: Low
Tactical Briefing: - High ammo capacity laser sidearm. - Stun capability. - Toggle burst available.
A sidearm is a soldiers last resort, commander. I want to make that last resort count and bring our glorious men one step closer to victory. At least that's what you would like to hear from me, isn't it? The truth is, your men have been pestering me about the laser pistol since the day we developed it. They have been complaining about the battery's capacity. Ignorant fools. Isn't it obvious that a alenium conductor and optical amplifiers small enough to fit in a pistol won't be as efficient as the ones used in rifles? Instead they argued, that if they use the same battery for rifles and pistols, then why do they get more shots from the more powerful rifle. Non-scientific reasoning. Why do I even take my meals in the same cafeteria as your mis-educated soldiers?
Fortunately for them, at times, science does also work the other way around. By working on advanced laser technology for our aircrafts we have opened up some unexpected paths leading to miniaturization of the mentioned optic devices. As for the conductor. It occurred to us that a few drops of Ceasan blood mixed with alenium do work wonders. I expect you do happen to encounter great numbers of Ceasan involuntary blood donors on a daily basis? Well even if you didn't, a few drops is what we need and I have already ordered a couple of gallons from my personal stores to be shifted to the factories. I do hope those oafs won't mistake it with the plum juice that's being distributed today.
Parango - the result of our work is a state of the art laser pistol which is twice as efficient in terms of battery consumption compared to our previous design. The beams themselves inflict the same damage as before, however the laser is much more bright which could help us in blinding the enemy and therefore making him easier to stun. Additionally, the built in burst mode should give your soldiers the needed advantage when aiming is not an option.
Admittedly, Parango is a bit heavier and produces some recoil due to aleniums instable nature, but it is still a very user-friendly weapon. I might consider making it mine weapon of choice, after all xenolaboratories aren't always the safest work environment.

Specifications: Snap Shot 40AP - 52% Accuracy Normal 65AP - 113% Accuracy Aimed 95AP - 153% Accuracy Fire Rate: Low Damage: High Pulse Focus Laser (94 Nominal damage, 50 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Medium Range of effect: Long Range
Tactical Briefing: - A more powerful and tactical version of a sniper rifle. - Advanced targeting system provides accurate shots at long ranges. - Very slow rate of fire. - Heavy to carry and difficult to reload. - Useless at close range, be careful using this weapon in urban or close-combat environments. - Only to be used by seasoned veterans.
AK7-A1 - Tactical Sniper Laser Cannon V1 is basically a very large Parango installed in a sniper mainframe, loaded with optic tools which give the marksman a stable and effective long range weapon. You could also say that it is a very small Scatterlaser as used by our aircrafts, without the rapid fire ability, nor the monstrous weight.
Dread, as your soldiers have dubbed is truly a weapon the likes you have not seen before, Commander. I must advise you that the designated sniper will have to poses significant strength to handle it. Although the stabilizing mechanism is a masterpiece and the weapon produces literally no tangible recoil, its pure weight might pose a problem for the more feeble men or be that women. Additionally the soldier must have superb reflexes and intuition. The beam starts charging when the trigger is pulled and is released when pressed again. The time brackets in which the beam needs to be released are between 2.8 and 4.1. seconds. If the shot is not made the weapon goes into cooldown mode. Did I mention that whilst the beam is charging you absolutely cannot move the cannon by more than an inch?
As you understand this is not a weapon for rookies, but I do recall one of your men killed one of my stray laboratory rats. He did it with by throwing a 9kg weight across the gym. Maybe pick that one? He seems like an able fellow who won't mind carrying a 16 kg cannon around. Make him suffer for killing Gustav.

It seems that our men have become quite accustomed to the Jackal armor family. Even though Jackals are providing less and less protection nowadays that the invaders started sending out soldiers instead of "poorly" armed escorts.
As our quartermaster remarked: 'It's always better to wear the clunky piece of heavy plates and have a chance to land in the sickbay for 2 weeks rather than having your arm melted away by one strayed bolt of plasma.' I'm glad we hire maimed veterans among our staff. It makes encouraging soldiers so much easier. Speaking of which I would like you to encourage your men to test out our new armor on the battlefield.
The Coyote type armor builds on the foundations of the Jackal but enhances the concept through means of our latest research on alien materials and the feedback collected from field operatives.
The armor provides 15% more damage resistance than the Jackal and goes along with a navy-blue jumpsuits which provides basic protection against biological and chemical hazards.
It makes me think that I will have to establish some dress code rules. My junior assitants seem to have tucked away their lab coats and are now all parading around in those horidly informal jumpsuits. Makes me feel like im on the battlefield myself.

Specifications: - Burst Fire 50AP - 30% accuracy - Fire Rate: Medium - Clip Size: 6x Mini Rocket bundle - Damage: Compact Rocket - (Depending on explosives tech, approximately 60% of the originally sized rockets) - Armor Penetration: Incendiary Explosive - Range of effect: Medium range
Tactical briefing: - The compact model of rockets allows this weapon to fire the full load of explosives in one burst. - Depending on the enemies armor, used as a lethal weapon or as a heavy suppression platform. - Ideal for razing buildings. - Intended to be used exclusively with power armors. Heavy to operate even for xenonauts equipped with power armors. - DO NOT USE IN URBAN ENVIRONMENT!
Commander. I believe you summoned me due to that rumbling noise coming from the labs? No reason to be alarmed, although the lab is going to need a new practice range. Im afraid that the new rocket launcher we developed brings out the worst instincts in our staff members. I admit, it might have been reckless to allow the testing to be done underground. Even if we are using low-explosive rounds.
The Heavy Advanced Rocket Launcher or RPG Rage model YT-63 was designed to turn our power armored units into miniaturized rapid-fire tanks and as with Sulfur I urge you not to "drive" our little tanks into civilian buildings.
Now if you could call those baboons from manufacturing to take away that horidly noisy prototype from my laboratory I would be most pleased.

Specifications: - Burst Fire: 55AP - 28% accuracy - Fire Rate: Low - Clip Size: 3x Mini Rocket Bundle - Damage: Compact Rocket (Depending on explosives tech, approximately 60% of the originally sized rockets) - Armor Penetration: Incendiary Explosive - Range of effect: Medium range
Tactical briefing: - Compact rockets deal less damage but are fired in burst mode. - Well suited for suppressing heavy armored aliens. - Difficult to reload and operate: intended for veteran xenonanuts. - Ideal for destroying obstacles. - DO NOT USE IN URBAN ENVIRONMENT
Commander, honestly speaking, I had my doubts about pursuing this line of research. Heavy explosives used in tactical missions result in far fewer alien specimen on our lab tables. A fact, that I am sure, you perfectly understand by now. I am afraid the same thing cannot be said about some of our more trigger-happy field operatives. However, going through latest battle reports I do understand that our situation is becoming more and more desperate and our troops are going to need effective means of defending themselves... or, may that be, defending our entire civilization.
I do believe that the newly developed Tactical Rocket Launcher (codename: Sulfur) will greatly enhance our means of survival. Sulfur is designed to obliterate a given area of impact by sending out not one but three missiles at once. The codename was proposed by some of our more skeptical lab colleagues who argued that the weapon would result in no new artifacts to be salvaged and the only things left would be ash and the bitter aftertaste of barbaric destruction. I am sure your soldiers will love the smell. Speaking of soldiers, I do advise you to permit usage of Sulfur only to your most experienced and bulky xenonauts. The weapon requires a substantial amount of strength to handle; above average marksmanship is also required as we do not want stray missiles scattered all around the battlefield.
When fighting more armored and resilient aliens Sulfur can provide excellent suppression fire. It can also be used as a kind of portable ram. Well if you consider having a ram that removes the door along with a huge part of the wall...or the whole building. I therefore strongly advise you against the use of Sulfur in urban areas - where civilians might be present.

Commander, we need to achieve air supremacy whilst the enemy crafts are still in the process of adjusting their machines to our atmosphere. Unfortunately, enemy scouts have already started destroying friendly military airports. Naturally, there are still a lot of camouflaged airport bases, but our organization has agreed (That is: we were forced to agree) not to use them, as we do not want to draw alien retaliation upon unprepared local forces. In this situation we will need to establish our own bases across the planet, but this will take some time and will require a substantial amount of resources. As a provisional solution weve decided to introduce a new aircraft into our fleet.
I did feel that we still lacked a machine that would be able to take part in long range missions, whilst still being able to take the role of a dogfighter. Apart from that, the world is a big place and a lot of conventional nation-based radar stations have already been destroyed by the invaders... therefore a reconnaissance aircraft would also greatly contribute in the field of duty.
Putting things bluntly: a multirole combat aircraft. And that is exactly what M2x Apollo is. A multirole combat aircraft capable of scouting, training, supporting crafts and bases (even at extreme distances) and if need be: engaging and shooting down the enemy.
Apollo is a glimpse of what can be achieved when the world comes together. The airframe was taken directly from the French Mirage 2000, but the avionics were upgraded by NATO specialist, whilst the Soviets disclosed all their top secret files on maneuverability advancements. But most importantly, we have managed to fine tune the engine and achieve breathtaking results. A chore that technicians from no single country could have accomplished on such a tight schedule. Admittedly, this could not have been done without a supreme supervisor. Namely myself.
But back to the point commander. M2x aircrafts will be now manufactured all over the world, and shipped to us when needed, though we will always need to make some of our own adjustments, the labor process should be relatively short.
Apollos can be used in all roles, however, at the same time, you should be very cautious on which missions and when you decide to use them. There is always a high chance that an Apollo will not make it back, even missions which might be considered milk runs for Condors might pose a threat to Apollos. The main reason being - it is a light aircraft. We use virtually no armor plating, much less any anti-plasma platting. Furthermore it is a long-ranged aircraft, which means the pilot is surrounded mostly by fuel rather than metal. This means that every plasma impact is potentially lethal. My exact calculations? I would say that Apollo will be, on average, able to withstand 2, maybe 3 indirect hits. Enemy missiles? You mean those devastating, condensed plasma bolts that our Condor pilots are now so good at evading? Please give me a second to make my calculations... yes, yes. I estimate a finite number between null and zero. I'm sorry, Commander, but this must be said bluntly: you need to be extraordinary careful whilst deploying Apollo aircrafts. The life of our pilots lies in your hands.
Fortunately, Apollo is able of making evasive maneuvers. Unfortunately, the turn rate is rather low. Very low. Be wary, getting the better of our enemies position won't be easy and prolonged dogfights are dangerous. You can counter this by commanding the pilot to slow the engine down and then making a turn, but be wary. M2x achieves substandard results in means of acceleration. Reaching full velocity might not happen as fast as the pilot would want, but on the other hand, the maximum velocity of Apollo is far beyond anything that our crafts OR the alien ones could achieve, at least to this day.
Tactical briefing: - Extreme velocity and range there can be used as a support aircraft, bringing down damaged and escaping crafts. - Long radar range and high fuel levels - excellent map coverage. - Due to its speed and thus escape capabilities it can serve the role of a lightweight missile carrier. - Low acceleration and turn rate. - Very fragile - do not get in the range of enemy plasma blasters! - Be cautios when engaging fighter-class UFOs.

I would like to say that an enemy weapon that only subdues the target is a good thing. But then again this weapon is specifically built to handle humans. Most of the animals tested on, did not suffer the severe reaction, that human beings do. Im concerned, Commander. The aliens seem to adapt their technology towards anti-human weapons. This would mean that they certainly havent come here for a short visit. If they are determined to adapt, it means they are determined to stay. To take our planet away from us.
The weapon subdues humans by putting them in delirious states. The chemicals used seem to work like a drug, thoughhow should I put thisnot in a strictly biological ways. The brain does not receive any narcotics, the production of hormones is unaffected. It is as though the human mind is collapsing from within. In ways we do not even comprehend.
The volunteers seem to be recovering by now and I think we can release them from quarantine soon enough. The chemical seems to be only a means of incapacitating a human opponent. They are not directly involved in the process of changing people into Gargols. Your worries have, fortunately, been inaccurate, Commander.

I have researched the enemy's Light Vortex Launches, as we now call it. It is a device for capturing humans alive, though at times, being hit may also result in death. This is caused by the incapacitating, chaotic substance used in these weapons - vortex.
The substance is of purplish color and that seems to be the only characteristic that does not change through applying pressure, temperature, velocity, energy or simply the factor of time. In every other way the behavior of this substance remains unpredictable and chaotic. It changes, seemingly random, between states of liquid, gas and solid body. I'm afraid we are in no way able to reproduce the results in a scientific manner. Worst of, all it does not just simply randomly change its molecular bindings, it does also, at times transcend into radiation. Atoms are transformed into waves and then again form back into atoms. I do not want to bore you, Commander, with the list of physical laws this overrules, but on the practical side, you might consider how devastating this might be on the battlefield. Imagine a bullet leaving the barrel whilst seeming weightless, and then, right before reaching the target, turning into the equivalent of solid steel. Or even worse: bypassing our armor as radiation and then turning solid beneath the flesh. Fortunately, the amount of vortex used with the Light Vortex Launcher is minimal (hence the LIGHT Vortex Launcher) and thus it will only mildly puncture our soldiers insides (needle sized internal wounds may occur). It will also dissolve after a while so in most cases advanced surgery will not be needed. However, if, for example, the heart is punctured...
It would be useful to study different kinds of vortex powered weapons. We might then be able to better understand vortex itself.
One more thing, Commander. I cannot say this will be a strict rule in combat, but it does seem to me that the weapon was designed for Sebillians and Ceasans. The grip seems to indicate that much, and so far this is being conformed in our combat reports.

The Heavy Vortex Launcher is a weapon predominantly used by Harridans and Androns and it has been reported by our field agents, that these weapons are the main device of mass-abduction missions. The amount of vortex used in each shot enables the invaders too hit more than one target at a time.
I must admit that I am not as much interested in the battle specifications and applications of this weapon, Commander. What is much more interesting to us - scientists - is the amount of Vortex stored in a single projectile. I do believe that by studying this substance, we will one day be able to adopt it to our arsenal.

Vortex. A material of unknown origin, as I have earlier called it. There is, in fact, no substance on earth which would even come close to the atomic structure of this mysterious material. I dare say that we are not even dealing with atoms anymore. As controversial as this may sound, I do believe it might be some kind of by-product of dark matter. At this point: having seen things s-f writers did not even imagine, developing and discovering new technologies every goddamn day, and basically saving humanity on a daily basis well Im not afraid anymore to state even the most bold and controversial theories.
As with alenium, there is of course no possibility to reproduce it (or not yet at least, maybe tomorrow?) . But, as with alenium our brave minds have yet again, in a way, succeeded. This is our nature, Commander. The nature of adapting and retaliating. When saber-tooth cats attacked our ancestors, we retaliated by carving saber-tooth knives. When thick-hided herds of animals trampled our berry bushes, we took their skins, and turned them into our food, their furs, into our armor. When lightning struck down our shelters, we harnessed its by-product: fire. And we set the world ablaze. We are going to set the world ablaze once again, Commander. And in due time, we will set THEIR world ablaze. Mark my words!
Vortex is the key of bringing my words into motion. I do not know whether the aliens have underestimated our ability of adapting their technologies or if they are simply ignorant. But I do know, that they are going to gravely regret it.
Commander, before you lies a vortex filled bullet. We cannot create vortex, but we do know how to mold it, we do know how to use it. We do know how to harm the invaders with it. With your permission I will begin work on adapting our arsenal to this new projectile. Your men might soon need it.

Specifications: Snap Shot 18AP - 32% accuracy Normal 28AP - 54% Accuracy Aimed 48AP - 111% Accuracy Fire Rate: Single shot Damage: Vortex Powered Ammo Caliber .50 (46 Nominal damage, 30 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: Medium Range of effect: Medium
Tactical Briefing: - Improved version of Warhawk effective against almost all enemies, lethal against some. - Laser Sights mounted; providing high accuracy and better range of effect compared to other pistols. - Difficult to use and has only the capacity of holding 6 bullets. - Hard to reload.
As promised, the scientists always deliver. This is a mark II Warhawk WR-H60A, with all the technology, both ours and alien we have managed to create a handgun sturdy enough to be compatible with the previously developed vortex ammunition. Understandably, words such as sturdy come along with others like recoil and heaviness but they also expand our lexicon by adding lethal and penetrating.
Basically, the Warhawk mk II delivers everything its predecessor did and more. It serves the same role. And it definitely needs an experienced xenonaut to handle. Preferably one that is already acknowledged with the previous model.
Laser sights will be installed on all models. After discussing this with your team we have decided to resign from creating a dual version of this firearm. Firstly, because these weapons are becoming still more difficult to handle. Secondly, your men do prefer the safety of a shield in their second hand (while some of the more violent did opt for grenades). Finally, and most importantly we should try to preserve our vortex reserves, therefore every shot should be a hit, every shot should count. Advanced laser sights should make that easier. I do hope you will put this weapon to good use, Commander.

Peace Keeper TSR-V1 Specifications: Snap Shot 24AP - 43% accuracy Aimed 66AP - 95% Accuracy (laser sights) Burst Fire: 32AP - 32% Accuracy Fire Rate: High Damage: Plasma Vortex Powered Ammo (55 Nominal damage, 15 Stun Damage) Armor Penetration: High Range of effect: All ranges
Tactical Briefing: - Top of the line in Plasma technology, comparable to Alien Heavy Plasma Rifles - High powered ammunition powered by vortex provides this weapon exceptional armor penetration. - Our Knowledge of advanced rifles let us calibrate burst fire up to 4 bullets per action. - Costly to produce and difficult to handle.
Igitur qui desiderat pacem, praeparet bellum. Publius Vegetius might have been right about it. Though, maybe he did mixed it up a bit? If you want peace prepare for war. But what if we have war? Do we prepare peace? Scientists certainly do. Peace Keeper TSR-V1; the codename does have a rather nice ring to it, doesnt it? The name was actually proposed by one of your men. They do seem to visit us at the laboratory ever more often nowadays. It seems that they are finally starting to feel gratitude for all the work we are putting into this operation.
Peace Keeper is what I was referring those months ago when we developed that first Vortex powered bullet. The time when I gave that vengeful, uproarious speech. Well, a lot of time has passed and a lot of brave men have died, unaware of the promise I gave that day. I do hope you have it in you to revenge them for me, Commander.
The weapon offers unprecedented armor penetration. There will no longer be neither a Ceasan nor Harridan who will feel safe behind one of their armored suits. The impact damage should also be sufficient to penetrate a skull or two, whatever the skulls species might be.
Commander, this is, as always, a weapon for veterans. But do we even have anything less than veterans anymore? I dont even know anymore, Ive been closed in my laboratory for the past months, I couldnt bare to walk outside, not before finishing my work. I probably wouldnt had noticed if there was another base attack during that period. And I havent met any of your men outside of my lab for a long time. I do hope your lads are doing fine. I do hope we will be able to finish this work sir, my work, your work. This must come to an end someday. Let us prepare for that peace that will one day come.

We will not be able to repel an enemy invasion by using one type of aircraft alone. Whilst Condors are ideal for shooting down light crafts, we still need a heavy fighter that will provide us with more options in case the invaders manage to bring some of their bigger crafts into our airspace.
The Soviets were on a good way to creating a heavy interceptor which would be able to combat any NATO aircrafts: F15s among others. Ironically, the Soviet prototype: T10. Will now be equipped with many of F15s systems. All for a greater good. The T10 suffered from various defects, Im sure the Russians would be able to pan those out themselves in a couple of years. But we no longer have those years (neither will we be fighting NATOs air force). Instead we rushed the development project and a T-10 F15 hybrid emerged. The Russians dubbed it Su-27; code: Red Eagle. But we will use our own terminology to avoid confusion with local military forces. And of course: our crafts will be enhanced with the latest anti-alien technology - to improve performance.
Our Su-T10 will serve as a heavy fighter and will therefore be used to combat more sturdy alien crafts. Su-T10 can mount many more rockets than our Concords, and the damage output will naturally be much higher. The airframe was covered with twice as much titanium which should provide increased durability. Unfortunately, this did force us to reduce the weight of the electronic locking-system. Aiming and picking out targets will be left to the pilot.
The codename: Cheburashka comes from one of our pilots first experiences with the T-10 prototype. The aircraft allows for extreme maneuvers both at low and high speed. Naturally, this will cause nausea to some of our less trained pilots. The mentioned pilot was shaky on his feet hours after the flight. It reminded the Soviet instructors of a Russian cartoon featuring a shaky, toppling creature the Cheburashka.
What might, cause nausea to you, Commander, is the price we will have to pay for each aircraft. The drawback of using rushed prototypes is of course the lack of mass-produced parts. Also, as might have been expected the amount of titanium on the market has radically diminished over the past months and therefore the upkeep cost of our Su-T10 will be high as well.
Tactical briefing:
- Heavy fighter suited for fighting small and medium crafts. - Concords are still a better choice against light scouts and fighters. - Very good maneuverability. - Very high potential damage output (at the cost of limited initial damage). - High cost and upkeep.
It seems that one of our pilots has devised a new maneuver which might be useful when flying our new Su-T10 Cheburashka. Your secretary has already drawn up a first draft of the maneuver.

We have conducted preliminary experiments on the substance used in this new alien weapon. Battle reports indicate that, with luck, the weapon only subdues the victim, rather than outright killing him. We do not yet know how this is done, however it was discovered (as in most cases: accidentally) that morphine instead of easing any pain the patient might suffer, actually removes the subduing factor.
What this means, Commander. Is that you will be able to put your stunned soldier back on their feet, even during battle. All you need is a medic kit and a soldier whos bright enough to operate a syringe.
Though, I wouldn't advise sending morphine dosed soldier to the front line. In the best case scenario they will be knocked-out back to sleep. In the worst... I expect you already know your soldiers limitations better than I do.
